title: Period of benefit payments; issuance of further proclamations
context: §385-16 Period of benefit payments; issuance of further proclamations. Where the additional benefits provided by this chapter are made payable by the governor&rsquo;s proclamation after the occurrence of a disaster, the benefits shall be payable only for a period of one year after the effective date of the proclamation. Nothing herein shall prevent the governor from issuing further proclamations invoking this chapter in the event other disasters occur. [L 1961, c 157, pt of §1; Supp, §93B-17; HRS §385-16; am L 1972, c 47, §7]
